intro: Pelargonium ovale subsp. veronicifolium, commonly known as the Veronica-leaf geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves that resemble those of the plant Veronica. The plant produces showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value and adaptability contribute to its cultivation in various horticultural settings.
